elements.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
elements.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
elements.description: Originally published from 1954 through 1956, J.R.R. Tolkien's richly complex series ushered in a new age of epic adventure storytelling. A philologist and illustrator who took inspiration from his work, Tolkien invented the modern heroic quest novel from the ground up, creating not just a world, but a domain, not just a lexicon, but a language, that would spawn countless imitators and lead to the inception of the epic fantasy genre.

elements.title: Going Postal
elements.author: Terry Pratchett
elements.description: Arch-swindler Moist Van Lipwig never believed his confidence crimes were hanging offenses-until he found himself with a noose tightly around his neck, dropping through a trapdoor, and falling into-a government job?

elements.title: Ancillary Justice
elements.author: Ann Leckie
elements.description: On a remote, icy planet, the soldier known as Breq is drawing closer to completing her quest.

elements.title: A Memory Called Empire
elements.author: Arkady Martine
elements.description: During a time of political instability in the highest echelons of the imperial court, Ambassador Mahit Dzmare arrives in the center of the multi-system Teixcalaanli Empire only to discover that her predecessor, the previous ambassador from their small but fiercely independent mining Station, has died.
